extendedInfo.description: Can I use my cell phone while driving?  What about texting?  Does this state sell beer on Sundays?  What time do bars close?  Are sales taxes cheaper in the next state over?  Can I smoke in bars here?  Do I have to wear a helmet on my motorcycle?Common questions can now be answered with a touch of a button, with Law Buddy!  Law Buddy automatically determines your location based on the cell tower you're connected to and gives you the laws for that state!Law Buddy summarizes the laws of all 50 states (and DC) into one convenient Android application.  Even when you don't have a network connection, you can still pull up basic legal information to help save money or keep yourself out of trouble!A convenient map feature allows you to see whether surrounding states have more accommodating laws.  Save money by driving to a state with lower gas taxes; buy that new flat screen in a state with lower sales tax rates.Categories include:1) Sales Tax / Gasoline Tax2) Driving Laws3) Cell Phone Usage Laws4) Helmet Laws5) DUI Laws and Penalties6) Drug Possession Penalties7) Smoking Laws8) Alcohol Sale Laws9) Consent LawsAll categories are referenced with hyperlinks that allow you to go directly to the source of the information.Please Email us if you find any errors or would like to see additional laws included!Know your rights and protect yourself with Law Buddy!Disclaimer: Law Buddy is for entertainment purposes only.  While we make every effort to ensure the application information is accurate and up-to-date, laws are constantly being changed. For that reason you should seek the services of a competent professional before making any decisions based on the information provided in this application.

reviews.comment: Would have liked to see the links for more info be something other than Wikipedia, which is easier to access by itself.PS. Texting while driving kills
